{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question is about a study design. The study describes the surgical history of women with BRCA-mutation positive status, comparing those who underwent bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy to those who did not. This suggests that the study is analyzing the relationship between the procedure and the development of breast cancer. A case-control study involves comparing people with a specific outcome (in this case, breast cancer) to those without it, looking for factors that may have contributed to the outcome. The data collection method used in the study is also consistent with a case-control design. Therefore, the correct answer is C: Case-control.", "answer_choice": "C"}
